sen.j: 鴨都波神社（かもつばじんじゃ）は、奈良県御所市にある神社である。
sen.e: Kamotsuba-jinja Shrine is a Shinto shrine located in Gose City, Nara Prefecture.
Kamotsuba-jinja Shrine is a Shinto shrine located in Gose City, Nara Prefecture.
Kamotsuba-jinja Shrine is a Shinto shrine located in Gose City, Nara Prefecture.

sen.j: 式内社（名神大社）で、旧社格は県社。
sen.e: The shrine is a Shikinai-sha (Myojin Taisha, shrine listed in Engishiki ["Engishiki" is an ancient book for lows and regulation compiled during the Engi Period, in which shrine listing procedures are included]), designated as a prefectural shrine in the old shrine ranking.

The shrine is a Shikinai-sha (Myojin Taisha, shrine listed in Engishiki ["Engishiki" is an ancient book for lows and regulation compiled during the Engi Period, in which shrine listing procedures are included]), designated as a prefectural shrine in the old shrine ranking.

The shrine is a Shikinai-sha (Myojin Taisha, shrine listed in Engishiki ["Engishiki" is an ancient book for lows and regulation compiled during the Engi Period, in which shrine listing procedures are included]), designated as a prefectural shrine in the old shrine ranking.

sen.j: 積羽八重事代主命（事代主）とシタテルヒメを主祭神とし、建御名方神を配祀する。
sen.e: Kamotsuba-jinja Shrine enshrines Tsumihayae-Kotoshironushi-no-mikoto (also called Kotoshironushi-no-kami) and Shitateruhime (or Shitateruhime-no-kami) as main enshrined deities, while enshrining Takeminakata-no-kami as an associated god.

Kamotsuba-jinja Shrine enshrines Tsumihayae-Kotoshironushi-no-mikoto (also called Kotoshironushi-no-kami) and Shitateruhime (or Shitateruhime-no-kami) as main enshrined deities, while enshrining Takeminakata-no-kami as an associated god.

Kamotsuba-jinja Shrine enshrines Tsumihayae-Kotoshironushi-no-mikoto (also called Kotoshironushi-no-kami) and Shitateruhime (or Shitateruhime-no-kami) as main enshrined deities, while enshrining Takeminakata-no-kami as an associated god.

sen.j: 葛城氏・鴨氏によって祀られた神社である。
sen.e: The Katsuragi clan and the Kamo clan dedicated this shrine.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: The Katsuragi clan and the Kamo clan dedicated this shrine.
The Katsuragi clan and the Kamo clan dedicated this shrine.

sen.j: 高鴨神社（高鴨社）・葛城御歳神社（中鴨社）に対して「下鴨社」とも呼ばれる。
sen.e: Following Takakamo-jinja Shrine (also called Takakamo-sha Shrine, literally meaning "higher Kamo-jinja Shrine") and Katsuragimitoshi-jinja Shrine (also called Nakakamo-sha Shrine, literally meaning "middle Kamo-jinja Shrine"), Kamotsuba-jinja Shrine is also referred to as 'Shimogamo-sha Shrine' (literally meaning "lower Kamo-jinja Shrine").
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: Following Takakamo-jinja Shrine (also called Takakamo-sha Shrine, literally meaning "higher Kamo-jinja Shrine") and Katsuragimitoshi-jinja Shrine (also called Nakakamo-sha Shrine, literally meaning "middle Kamo-jinja Shrine"), Kamotsuba-jinja Shrine is also referred to as 'Shimogamo-sha Shrine' (literally meaning "lower Kamo-jinja Shrine").

Following Takakamo-jinja Shrine (also called Takakamo-sha Shrine, literally meaning "higher Kamo-jinja Shrine") and Katsuragimitoshi-jinja Shrine (also called Nakakamo-sha Shrine, literally meaning "middle Kamo-jinja Shrine"), Kamotsuba-jinja Shrine is also referred to as 'Shimogamo-sha Shrine' (literally meaning "lower Kamo-jinja Shrine").

sen.j: 事代主神は元々は鴨族が信仰していた神であり、当社が事代主神の信仰の本源である。
sen.e: As Kotoshironushi-no-mikoto was the deity believed by the Kamo clan, this shrine has become the foundation of the Kotoshironushi-no-mikoto belief.
As Kotoshironushi-no-mikoto was the deity believed by the Kamo clan, this shrine has become the foundation of the Kotoshironushi-no-mikoto belief.
As Kotoshironushi-no-mikoto was the deity believed by the Kamo clan, this shrine has become the foundation of the Kotoshironushi-no-mikoto belief.

sen.j: 大神神社（奈良県桜井市）に祀られる大国主の子に当たることから、「大神神社の別宮」とも称される。
sen.e: Kamotsuba-jinja Shrine is also referred to as 'an associated shrine of Omiwa-jinja Shrine' because Kotoshironushi-no-mikoto was the son of Okuninushi (chief god of Izumo in southern Honshu Island, Japan, and the central character in the important cycle of myths set in that region) enshrined in Omiwa-jinja Shrine (Sakurai City, Nara Prefecture).

Kamotsuba-jinja Shrine is also referred to as 'an associated shrine of Omiwa-jinja Shrine' because Kotoshironushi-no-mikoto was the son of Okuninushi (chief god of Izumo in southern Honshu Island, Japan, and the central character in the important cycle of myths set in that region) enshrined in Omiwa-jinja Shrine (Sakurai City, Nara Prefecture).

Kamotsuba-jinja Shrine is also referred to as 'an associated shrine of Omiwa-jinja Shrine' because Kotoshironushi-no-mikoto was the son of Okuninushi (chief god of Izumo in southern Honshu Island, Japan, and the central character in the important cycle of myths set in that region) enshrined in Omiwa-jinja Shrine (Sakurai City, Nara Prefecture).

sen.j: 下照姫命については、事代主とともに祀られることに疑問があることから、元は別の神が祀られていたものとみられる。
sen.e: Since it is difficult to find the reason why Shitateruhime-no-kami is enshrined with Kotoshironushi-no-kami, another deity was assumably enshrined at first.
Since it is difficult to find the reason why Shitateruhime-no-kami is enshrined with Kotoshironushi-no-kami, another deity was presumably enshrined at first.
Since it is difficult to find the reason why Shitateruhime-no-kami is enshrined with Kotoshironushi-no-kami, another deity was presumably enshrined at first.

sen.j: 当社の古い社名は「鴨弥都波（かもみつは）」であり、「鴨の水際（みづは）の神」と解せる。
sen.e: The old name of this shrine was 'Kamomitsuha,' which can be interpreted as 'a deity living in the waterside of Kamo.'
The old name of this shrine was 'Kamomitsuha,' which can be interpreted as 'a deity living in the waterside of Kamo.'
The old name of this shrine was 'Kamomitsuha,' which can be interpreted as 'a deity living in the waterside of Kamo.'

sen.j: 当地は葛城川と柳田川の合流地点であり、元々は水の神を祀っていたものとする説がある。
sen.e: A theory suggests that this shrine initially enshrined the deity of water because Katsuragi-gawa River and Yanagi-gawa River join at this district.
A theory suggests that this shrine initially enshrined the deity of water because Katsuragi-gawa River and Yanagi-gawa River join at this district.
A theory suggests that this shrine initially enshrined the deity of water because Katsuragi-gawa River and Yanagida-gawa River join at this district.

sen.j: また、事代主の妹である高照姫命が祀られていたのが下照姫命と混同されたとする説もある。
sen.e: Moreover, other theory suggests that Takateruhime-no-kami, the sister of Kotoshironushi-no-kami was enshrined in reality, who was confused with Shitateruhime-no-Kami.
Moreover, another theory suggests that Takateruhime-no-kami, the sister of Kotoshironushi-no-kami was enshrined in reality, who was confused with Shitateruhime-no-Kami.
Moreover, another theory suggests that Takateruhime-no-kami, the sister of Kotoshironushi-no-kami was enshrined in reality, who was confused with Shitateruhime-no-Kami.

sen.j: 社伝によれば、崇神天皇の時代、勅命により太田田根子の孫の大賀茂都美命が創建した。
sen.e: According to the shrine's biography, Okamotsubime, the grandchild of Otataneko founded Kamotsuba-jinja Shrine by an Imperial order during the reign of the Emperor Sujin.
According to the shrine's biography, Okamotsubime, the grandchild of Otataneko founded Kamotsuba-jinja Shrine by an Imperial order during the reign of the Emperor Sujin.
According to the shrine's biography, Okamotsubime, the grandchild of Otataneko founded Kamotsuba-jinja Shrine by an Imperial order during the reign of the Emperor Sujin.

sen.j: 一帯は「鴨都波遺跡」という遺跡である。
sen.e: This shrine is standing amid the remains called 'Remains of Kamotsuba.'
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: This shrine is standing amid the remains called 'Remains of Kamotsuba.'
This shrine is standing amid the remains called 'Remains of Kamotsuba.'

sen.j: 弥生時代の土器や農具が多数出土しており、古くから鴨族がこの地に住みついて農耕をしていたことがわかる。
sen.e: Lots of earthenware and farming equipments in the Yayoi period excavated from the remains show that the Kamo clan had settled in this district to engage in farming since long ago.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: Lots of earthenware and farming equipments in the Yayoi period excavated from the remains show that the Kamo clan had settled in this district to engage in farming a long time ago.
Lots of earthenware and farming equipments in the Yayoi period excavated from the remains show that the Kamo clan had settled in this district to engage in farming a long time ago.

sen.j: 延喜式神名帳では「鴨都波八重事代主命神社 二座」と記載され、名神大社に列している。
sen.e: In Engishiki Shinmyo Cho (a Jinja shrines' list under the Engishiki), Kamotsuba-jinja Shrine is listed under 'Kamotsuhayae-Kotoshironushi-no-kami-jinja Shrine enshrining two deities,' ranked among the Myojin Taisha.

In Engishiki Shinmyo Cho (a list of shrines in the Engishiki), Kamotsuba-jinja Shrine is listed under 'Kamotsuhayae-Kotoshironushi-no-kami-jinja Shrine enshrining two deities,' ranked among the Myojin Taisha.

In Engishiki Shinmyo Cho (a list of shrines in the Engishiki), Kamotsuba-jinja Shrine is listed under 'Kamotsuhayae-Kotoshironushi-no-kami-jinja Shrine enshrining two deities,' ranked among the Myojin Taisha.

sen.j: 延喜式巻三「臨時祭」では「鴨神社 二座」と記されている。
sen.e: In 'Rinji Matsuri' (literally meaning, an extraordinary festival), the third volume of Engishiki, this shrine is listed under 'Kamo-jinja Shrine enshrining two deities.'
In 'Rinji Matsuri' (literally meaning, an extraordinary festival), the third volume of Engishiki, this shrine is listed under 'Kamo-jinja Shrine enshrining two deities.'
In 'Rinji Matsuri' (literally meaning, an extraordinary festival), the third volume of Engishiki, this shrine is listed under 'Kamo-jinja Shrine enshrining two deities.'

sen.j: 大正10年（1927年）に県社に列格した。
sen.e: Kamotsuba-jinja Shrine was designated as a prefecture shrine in 1921.
sen.cmt: 大正10年は1921年になると思います。原文の1927年は訳中にはいれませんでした。
sen.e: Kamotsuba-jinja Shrine was designated as a prefectural shrine in 1921.
Kamotsuba-jinja Shrine was designated as a prefectural shrine in 1927.
